column1: Port & TCP or UDP> SMTP Secure
column3: Secure version of SMTP using STARTTLS.

column1: What is the maximum number of primary partitions on an MBR disk?

column1: BCD store meaning on an MBR Disk
column3: Where Windows boot options are stored. It includes boot configuration parameters for how to launch Windows. GRUB or LILO is Linux equivalent.

column1: GPT meaning in disk partitioning/boot scheme
column3: boot information is not restricted to a single sector but still serves the same basic purpose of identifying partitions and OS boot loaders.
Fixed disk self-diagnostic program. SMART can alert the operating system if a failure is detected.
Using VM's as a means of Provisioning corporate desktops; often accessed via thin clients.
installed at the customer’s premises converts the optical signal to an electrical one. Connected to the customer’s router using an RJ45 copper wire patch cord.
Located in a street cabinet. From the OLT- splitters direct each subscriber’s traffic over a short length of fiber to an optical network terminal (ONT) installed at the customer’s premises.
A connection to an internet service provider's (ISP’s) network uses its nearest point of presence (PoP) such as a local telephone exchange.
In a PON- FTTP: a single fiber cable is run from the point of presence to a street cabinet; a splitter directs traffic over a shorter length fiber to ONT on premises.

column1: Small core fiber that carries long wavelength
column3: SMF: supports data rates up to 10 Gbps and cable runs of many kilometers. 8-10 micron core/1310 or 1550 nm wavelength.

column1: Large core fiber that carries shorter wavelengths
column3: MMF: slower signal speeds and shorter distances - better for LANs than WANs. 50 or 62.5 micron core/850 or 1300 nm wavelength. Cheaper.
Low-cost laser used in Multi-mode fiber; faster than LED; good for short-range fiber like 10GBASE-SR

column1: Fiber: bayonet-style connector that uses a push-and-twist locking mechanism
column3: ST: bayonet-style; push-and-twist; used mostly on older multi-mode networks.
SC: simple push/pull insertion. Simplex and Duplex versions (duplex = 2 connectors clipped together). Single or Multi-Mode.
LC: small form factor; Tabbed push/pull design. Small size allows higher port density than SC.

column1: When should a tech perform a backup during troubleshooting?
column3: Backups are part of identifying the problem to avoid data loss before performing repairs
UEFI provides support for 64-bit CPU operation at boot; a full GUI and mouse operation at boot; networking functionality at boot; and better boot security.
